etymology.description: semantic: 钅(金) (jīn, "metal") + phonetic: 艮(艮) (gèn) = metal sound -> silver
etymology.interpretation: The character combines the metal radical 钅(金) (jīn, "metal") indicating that it is a type of metal, with the phonetic 艮(艮) (gèn), which guides the pronunciation. Silver is a precious metal, aligning with the metal semantic component.
etymology.simplification: 金 was simplified to 钅 as a more concise representation while retaining its meaning of metal in the simplified character 银.

examples.chinese: 我有银子(我有銀子)，想买东西(想買東西)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ yǒu yínzi, xiǎng mǎi dōngxī.
examples.english: I have silver and want to buy something.

examples.chinese: 银色的车(銀色的車)很漂亮。
examples.english: The silver car is very beautiful.

examples.chinese: 他买了一枚银戒指(銀戒指)。
examples.pinyin: Tā mǎile yī méi yín jièzhǐ.
